title: I think it is baiscally official that the Akali rework is an unfixable failure.
body:
Long time Akali players hate it even if they got use to the kit since her ban rate is still about 45% after countless nerfs leaving her in an abysmal spot where I highly doubt even pros would pick her for being "broken". And don't act like it is all better now. It is going to get nerfed again in a few patches. Yes I am calling it now. If anything the rework took issues Akali already had, amplified them, and added several more.

The high ban rate suggest that people hate facing Akali more than other champs.

Riot, are you ever going to learn that letting CertanlyT having free reign with a kit design is just asking for an impossible to balance nightmare. Be it Zyra, Kalista, Yasuo, Darius, Akali or Zoe.

Are they fun to play as? Sure. 
Are they rewarding to play against? Hell no they literally make you feel like you can't do anything when the champ is at all strong.

The only reason Warwick didn't fail was because CertanlyT was only a part of the rework.

Yes, I know CertanlyT is likely working on a new champ or rework right now, and it is going to be another frustrating migraine to play against with something like a 4 second windwall making ults disappear, turret diving stealth, kill dragon to push a lane for the next 2 minutes or nuke an enemy from across the map.

Many of us do not want him on the design and rework team because his designs consistently cross lines of feeling unfair to play against.

You don't know how to fix Yasuo, you don't know how to fix Zoe, You don't know how to fix Akali, Mord or Kalista and the moment any of them get buffed they will have their ban rates skyrocket.

Try to treat the symptoms all you want but until you treat the source the problem is not going away.

I think Akali rework is the perfect demonstration of the community being a bunch of crybabies more than anything. Compared to many other champions, Akali does not feel "unfair" to play against at all. Hell I would be happy if I could face Akalis all day instead of a frakkin' Kayn, who auto-attacks me and I die. In case I don't he clicks R (targeted ability) which automatically refreshes his duskblade which is tied to an auto-attack again (so much potential to miss you know). And this is just one example.

I can't possibly comprehend what is the people's problem with the shroud. It's the easiest ability to play against. All you have to do is walk away. It's that simple. I feel like all of you just try to fight it out in her shroud where she's strong just so you can submit another post against CertainlyT and get the sweet karma for it. Playing against Akali in lane is so simple, everything is so predictable and telegraphed. Unless you play in the top 1% of the playerbase where Akali can really shine (which most of you don't), that champion is so weak in hands of an average player. I haven't lost to a single Akali that I can remember in high gold/low plat elo. Literally free midlane playing against that champion.

I would say Akali is one of the best reworks along with Irelia in terms of champion design, gameplay and overall feel. Both of these reworks really amplify the theme of the champion. It makes you feel like Akali truly is an assassin ninja instead of another dull generic ap caster or whatever.

And now before you all pick up the pitchforks that this is comming from an Akali player...no. I'm a Lux main, and an Ashe....enthusiast. Neither of these champions have a particularly easy time against Akali. Yet, I don't have the slightest problem with her.

It makes me really sad that we're submiting these posts instead of putting some effort into learning to play against these champions which ultimately will make another great design rot in the dumpster. A year or two ago, I would say that CertainlyT is like a plague to this game, but at this point it has grown into a disgusting, unfair and unjust scheme of automatically discarding everything that comes from CertainlyT. The amount of hate he is getting is far beyond anything justified and I really feel bad for the guy...
